channel.title: Self-Improvement on Learn, Converse, Share
channel.description: Recent content in Self-Improvement on Learn, Converse, Share

item.title: Thoughts about reading computer books
item.description: I have been coding ASP.NET for about 4 years now.  I had a co-worker bring a book to work titled “Essential ASP.NET” by Fritz Onion.  I skimmed it and it looked very interesting do to it’s text on application pools and low level information that I’ve always taken for granted.  I finished reading a few of the other books lounging around my house and decided that I wanted to read it.  I inquired with my co-worker on that very thing and he told me he had given it to another co-worker.  To make a long story short, I’m currently borrowing that copy of the text.
